quest.name: Never Steer You Wrong
journal:
 Quest Sync
Duzal Meyean the Steady seeks a discerning Disciple of the Hand to assist his team of crafts...birds in fixing the flaws of vital components.
※The crafting portion of this quest is recommended for Disciples of the Hand level 15 and above, and the battle portion for Disciples of War or Magic level 48 and above.

Duzal Meyean has asked you to synthesize high-quality steering mechanism components to be installed on the Dezul Qualan. Proper equipment to craft these items, however, is only found at the Diamond Forge in Revenant's Toll. Speak with forgewife Fyrbryda about receiving permission to utilize the facilities.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

Fyrbryda's rules for the forge are simple: one, all materials brought inside must be inspected for contraband, and two, if anyone wishes to make use of the facilities, they must first provide a generous contribution to the Revenant's Toll chapter of the Adventurers' Guild. Currently, the guild is concerned about a group of Coerthans harassing travelers who pass near Camp Revenant's Toll. Make your way to their campsite and force them to leave, by any means necessary.

You have resolved the situation in the same way as countless ones before. Return to Fyrbryda and relay to her the good news. Also, do not forget to submit the steering mechanism component materials to the forgewife for inspection.

Fyrbryda has granted you access to the Diamond Forge's crafting facilities. Use the materials given to you by Duzal Meyean and inspected by Fyrbryda to synthesize high-quality steering mechanism components. Once completed, return to Ehcatl with the items.

※In the event that the status Facility Access: Specialization wears off or the synthesis ends in failure, you may try again by speaking with Fyrbryda.

You have delivered the steering mechanism components to Duzal Meyean. One look at your exquisite craftsmanship has made plain the error in his work, reminding him that no man─or bird─is perfect. Thanks to your efforts, the Ixal are now one step closer to completing the Dezul Qualan.
objectives: Speak with Fyrbryda in Revenant's Toll.
Speak with the suspicious Coerthans at Camp Revenant's Toll.
Present the steering mechanism component materials to Fyrbryda.
Synthesize steering mechanism components Deliver the steering mechanism components to Duzal Meyean the Steady.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Caw! Reliable hands, I seek. Feathered, featherless, I care not. My brethren, I love, but all talons, they are. Grace, they have not. Perfection, they cannot achieve.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Tasked with crafting of Dezul Qualan's steering mechanism, we were. But perfect, mechanism is not. Stiff, the control levers are, like withering autumn treant past its prime.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Tasked with crafting of Dezul Qualan's steering mechanism, we were. But perfect, mechanism is not. Horrible sounds, it makes, like wild hoglets in mating season. Problem lies in lubricating oil, I suspect.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Tasked with crafting of Dezul Qualan's steering mechanism, we were. But perfect, mechanism is not. Stuck, the control levers become, like bones in craw after hearty feasting.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Materials, we have secured, but facilities, we have not. Seek Fyrbryda in Revenant's Toll, you must. Though spurned, an Ixal is, welcome to use gifts of art and knowledge, featherless ones are.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: To the Diamond Forge, you must go. To Fyrbryda, you must speak. The gifts of art, she tends. Guide you to perfection, she shall. Caw caw!

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: There is work to be done, so I will not waste time mincing words. My rules here are simple. Follow them, and you are free to use the facilities for as long as you need.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: Rule one─aught that passes through those doors must be inspected. I will have no contraband within my walls. Period. Rule two─you make a contribution of my choice to the Revenant's Toll chapter of the Adventurers' Guild. No questions asked. No exceptions.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: If that suits you, journey to Camp Revenant's Toll─or what's left of it─and force the group of Coerthans who've pitched camp in the ruins to leave. Normally, we wouldn't mind, but they're said to be belligerent, threatening anyone passing through the area.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: If it doesn't, you can leave, and allow countless innocent men and women to suffer at their hands.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: Journey to Camp Revenant's Toll and see that the Coerthans return to whence they came. Do this, and the facilities are yours to use as you see fit.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The Coerthan draws his weapon and attacks!

dialogue.name: BNPC01519
dialogue.text: Another damned adventurer!? I've had enough of your meddling!

dialogue.name: BNPC01519
dialogue.text: Piss off, adventurer! We're not leaving until we have what we came for!

dialogue.name: BNPC01519
dialogue.text: Leave? Hah! I'm not leaving...and neither are you!

dialogue.name: BNPC01519
dialogue.text: Why should I leave because you say so? What about what I want─like you dead at my feet!?

dialogue.name: BNPC01519
dialogue.text: Heh, what's another body for the crows? We've come too far to turn back now!

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: I have no doubt your powers of persuasion were enough to resolve the situation. Now then, show me your materials.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: As for your materials...though obviously of questionable origin, I have found naught the guild has deemed forbidden. Proceed, then.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: If you require more time or materials, do not hesitate to ask, for today I am in your debt. I did not mention it before, but my nephew was one of many assaulted by the Coerthans. He will rest easy now knowing those terrible men have been slain, as will I.

dialogue.name: FYRBRYDA
dialogue.text: I suppose this is farewell. If aught should happen to your work while on the road, do not hesitate to return here for additional materials, for this day I am in your debt. You see, the story of my nephew...it was a lie. In truth, it was I who suffered at the hands of those men. I prayed for retribution, and through you I finally claimed it.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Show me the components, you must! Perfection of featherless one's crafting, I would see. Caw!

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Disappoint, your work does not. Obvious now, the problem is, when looking at featherless one's crafting.

dialogue.name: DUZALMEYEAN
dialogue.text: Overconfident, I was. Overlook flaws in design, I did. But closer to the skies, we are, thanks to your creations. Caw caw!

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You now have access to the crafting facility.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
